Address: No 100, Hotel Road, Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka.
Excerpt: The Governor's Restaurant at Mt.Lavinia Hotel offers one of the better buffets in the city. We found that mostly everything tasted good, with an exceptional salad bar and arguably the best selection of desserts around.
Open_Time: Open 12.00 PM - 3.00 PM and 7.00 PM - 11.00 PM

Excerpt: Drunken Monkey is a popular restaurant and bar in Hikkaduwa, and one of the couple of places that still function during off-season. The food is average but it's a great place to hang out by the beach.

Cafe Orange Peel is less of a cafe and more of a very sophisticated bath-kadey - it is a popular new stop for the working crowd in Bambalapitiya. Their rice and curry is top class and comes in epic portions.

Pedlar's Inn Cafe is a popular stop in Galle fort (and so is their Gelato opposite the cafe) - the food is alright, but mostly it's the ambience that makes this place appealing, though there are better spots with better food in the Fort these days.

Address: 347, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
Excerpt: Swift service and healthy veggie options make Subway a worthy new franchise in Colombo.
Open_Time:
Open 7 AM - 11 PM (Monday - Wednesday), 
7 AM - 12 PM (Thursday - Sunday)

Excerpt: Queen's Cafe is a very popular fast food stop down Duplication Road that's been around for ages. It was closed for a while awaiting a face lift, but it's now open for business again.
Aahaara is a caterer that does wood-fired biriyani and rice and curry.
Agra is another one of those rare fine dining Indian restaurants in Colombo. They're not cheap but we think their food is definitely worth the price.
Theva Cuisine is of Kandy's few good restaurants. With great breads, excellent dessert and friendly service, it's definitely worth a visit.
Sigiri is a small but excellent Sri Lankan restaurant located in Manhattan, New York serving an authentic and impressive representation of Lankan cuisine.
Open_Time: Open 12.30 PM to 3.30 PM,  5.30 PM to 11 PM

Excerpt: Domenico's, headed by the former chef at Santoré was great addition to Colombo's pizza scene in 2014. Now they've expanded their menu with some much needed meats and it's that much better.
We've seen their brownies pop up on our news feed more than a few times.  So this time we made it a point to give Treats n Stuff a shot.  We can now see why they've got such a large following.
Open_Time: Open 8.00 AM - 6.00 PM (3 hours notice required)

Excerpt: Consider yourself a bona fide carnivore? Well then Backyard BBQ is just what you're looking for. They're a barbecue specialist in Mt.Lavinia that does delivery and take-out. They've got a great selection of western barbecue at a pretty good price.
The Bread Company does excellent breads, sausages, pickles and more, and they do some of the  best sandwiches in the city and a good breakfast if you want to dine in.
Open_Time:
Open Tuesday- Friday.  7 AM- 6 PM
Saturday :  7 AM - 5 PM
Sunday: 8 AM -  2 PM
(Closed on all Mondays and public Holidays )

Excerpt: Chana's has been gaining popularity for sometime now and it's easy to see why. They do a pretty good take on North Indian cuisine and their biriyani is one of the best in town.
Kandoori is an Indian restaurant that serves just biriyani and other Indian food.
Cremalato is a local gelato manufacturer that actually delivers frozen confections.  We tried a bunch of their new flavours and we think they're pretty awesome.
Monster Cookies is a home baker that does a variety of cookies and since of late, brownies as well. We tried out some of their more interesting choices and we were all smiles.
Bilal Hotel is a little kade on Bamba's Galle Road that serves kottu, fried rice, biriyani and the likes. The prices are low and the kottu is super cheesey.

For those looking for healthy food in Colombo, the choices are limited, but The Salad Bar in Rajagiriya is looking to change that. They're a tiny stall that offers a range of salads at affordable rates. The best part is that they actually deliver.
Prego is an Italian restaurant in Negombo. Although the prices are high, the food is quite authentic and the ambience is chilled out.

Colombo has a ton of Chinese eateries, but Tong Ni BBQ hidden away on Walukarama Road (behind Subway), is one that is truly unique. The food is good and you get to see it being cooked right on your table. It may not suit everyone but we found it entertaining.
Giovanni's is a little Italian pizza place run by a chef who uses his own recipes, and serves fresh from a clay oven.
Sugar Bistro Galle Fort is a smaller rendition of Sugar Bistro and Wine Bar in Colombo, serving the same great food and drank at a stylish new address at the Galle Dutch Hospital.
Pink Sugar is a new home baker which remixes classic flavors like  Oreo, Ferrero Rocher and Irish cream.

So among all the delivery joints thankfully cropping up in Colombo for the benefit of those of us who want to eat lazily at home, Choco Luv has made itself known as an unlikely contender in the realm of pizza delivery.
Buth Amma's Buth Kade is a hole-in-the-wall rice and curry spot in Bamba, run out of a family home for 68 years.

Address: Arpico Super Store, 69, Hyde Park Corner, Colombo 02
Excerpt: Frozen is a 'gourmet' ice cream place at Urban Kitchen. The prices are fine and they've got some interesting options on their menu.
Top Secret is a very cool beach hangout in Hikkaduwa. We loved the ambience and the food is good without  being too pricey.
Icebear Century Café is a very cool place to chill out at in Negombo - it's a quirky hangout and novelty shop in an old house.

Address: 15A, Robert Road, off Quarry Road, Dehiwala
Excerpt: CuppaCrème is a home baker who is amazing at choc biscuit pudding and red velvet cupcakes.

Ambrosia does baked goodies, but they're not a home baker. They're a company, but the stuff we had was made by a very skilled hand and given the special attention that only home bakers are known to give.
A little rooftop spot in the Fort serving up a variety of crepes.
The Sweet Tooth or TST, is a small home baker that specializes in jars full of baked goods. We tried a bunch of different jars (along with some other stuff) and they were all pretty great.
We dropped in at the Java Lounge in Bambalapitiya the other day, and it's actually pretty good. They've got an accessible location, good coffee and some awesome desserts.
The Sweeter Side is another home baker - the prices are fine, the cakes are a bit bread-texture, we like the fudge brownies.
Sweet Layers is a home baker based in Piliyandala. They offer a range of baked goods, but their pastries are what really sets them apart.
China Town is a little restaurant on Marine Drive that serves big sloppy portions of spicy Sri Lankan-Chinese and even some Indian.
Quick Thai serves up pretty good, filling Thai dishes at affordable prices.
Anzu's restaurant on Marine Drive (Colpetty) is a new and authentic Chinese eating house. While it may not suit everyone, it's a good option for those looking to experience Chinese home cooking.

Address: Galle Dutch Hospital, Hospital Street, Galle Fort, Galle
Excerpt: The Tuna & The Crab is a mainly Japanese restaurant run by Sri Lanka's top chef Dharshan Munidasa in the Galle Fort. The quality is reliable but not game-changing, and the prices are high.
Cafe Francais is the only and best French restaurant in Colombo. It's expensive but really high quality dining.
Yumi Cake is a cute little restaurant that serves awesome desserts - chocolate fudge lovers, this is your haven.
Tasty home-cooked Jaffna style dishes - they do orders in bulk, so ideal for lunch or dinner parties.
This home baker does cake jars, and jars full of all kinds of candy.
We order from McDonald's far more than we probably should, but that's because their delivery is efficient, reliable and quite fast!
The Spectrum, formerly known as the Coco Fresh Bar, is a small waffle bar at the Liberty Arcade. The waffles are quite ordinary but they do a solid Milo shake.
Candle Light Hut is a pretty popular, affordable place for Pakistani biriyani, paratha and meat curries.

Address: 536/15, Wijesinghe Gardens,  Kotte Road, Pita Kotte
Excerpt: Affordable and pretty tasty office lunches, with free delivery.
Cakes & Things by Windya is a home baker in Mount Lavinia. Her specialty is theme cakes, but her cupcakes and brownies are pretty great as well.
Krishna is a good vegetarian spot for rice and curry and the likes at the Arcade. They're run by the same guys who run Mathura.
The Brick Lane Cookie Company opened up their newest stall in Fort a couple of weeks ago. We tried a bunch of their cookies along with their interesting new additions, and they were all pretty great.
Dolce Italia is a new little bakery cum restaurant run by two Italians. They serve pastries and Italian favourites that are both authentic and affordable.
Grand Beijing is another Chinese place around the Kollpity junction that serves up good, authentic dishes at affordable prices.
Itsy Bitsy Cupcakes is another home baker and they're big on covering their cupcakes with huge dollops of icing.
Indian Summer is a slightly expensive Indian restaurant, with a great ambience.

Calorie Counter with its emphasis on healthy eating was one of the best new additions to Colombo's restaurant scene in 2015. Now they've gone a  step further and introduced a pretty comprehensive breakfast menu, most of it actually tastes pretty great.
Sherry Land is a restaurant and pub in Negombo that offers one of the best cocktail menus we've come across in recent times, with some good food to boot.
Health Factor is an awesome little restaurant in Kohuwala that cooks up very tasty but healthy meals - at great prices.

Address: No. 98, Sri Saranankara Road, Kalubowila, Dehiwala
Excerpt: If you thought you'd tried the entire local burger monarchy, think again, cause we just found Burger Queen. It may not blow your mind, but they've got some interesting additions along with the usual favourites.

Address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Colombo Racecourse, Colombo 07
Excerpt: Saffron is a popular Iranian stall at Thursday's Good Market in Battaramulla. They serve some great Persian favourites, both sweet and savoury.

Address: 225, Visakha Road (at the Galle Road end), Galle Road, Colombo 04
Excerpt: Bombay Sweet Park is a small easily accessible shop in Bamba that does very good samosas and milkshakes - they've also got sweets and rice and curry.
Jeorgie's is a new burger place in Nawala - the burgers are huge (and not so healthy), and the fruit smoothies are amaze.

Restaurant_name: Jeewa's Polos and Kuma's Natural Foods
Address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Colombo Racecourse, Colombo 07
Excerpt: Jeewa's is a great place at the Good Market to have some proper Sri Lankan wraps, roast paan or roti, for cheap.
Dodol is a difficult dessert to find easily in Colombo shops - so we were ecstatic to find one that not only makes some but delivers dodol to your home.
Pho serves up simple and healthy Vietnamese food. It's not as flavorful as we'd like, but they're very new and we think they'll improve.
Open_Time: Open 10 to 11 PM, Closed On Mondays

Excerpt: Barista is the biggest coffee shop franchise in Colombo. Though their Laksala branch is just as so-so as the others in terms of food and drinks, it's got a lovely park-like ambience.
House of Biriyani is a new biriyani delivery and take out in Kalubowila. They offer good value for money along with a solid roast chicken, but they also have room for improvement.
The Ocean is the Kingsbury's seafood restaurant. The food is fresh off the ice onto the pan - it's good, and they also do a decent, affordable sashimi.
Aside from their buffet, OZO actually has a pretty good a-la carte menu with an interesting range of dishes from burgers to steak.
Foodie Adventure is a home cook in Nawala that does take away and delivery. We tried a bunch of her stuff and pretty much all of it was amazing. Which isn't something we say often.
Open_Time: Open 9.00 AM - 7.00 PM (24 hours in advance)

Excerpt: Harpo's has a new stand-alone pizza parlor in Nugegoda. Almost by default it's one of the nicer places in that town now, and it makes for faster delivery to the suburbs - from Kotte to Battaramulla.
Tammy is a Colombo home baker that specializes in some unconventional cakes. Her repertoire includes bibikkan, love cake and juggery cake, all of which were excellent.
Mango & Company is yet another new home baker. What sets M & G apart is their cinnamon rolls which are some of the best we've had in Sri Lanka.
Brownie Lovin' is one of Colombo's awesome brownie bakers. The brownies are extremely gooey and chocolatey, and affordable.

Address: 1st Floor, 10-02, Old Dutch Hospital, Hospital Street, Galle Fort, Galle
Excerpt: Thai Heritage is one of the many chic little restaurants on the foyers of the Old Dutch Hospital building in the Galle fort. The food though not striving for authenticity, is still alright, and somewhat on par with most fancy diners in the fort.

Galle Caterers are one of the older caterers in Colombo with quite a large customer-base. We've tried their stuff on numerous occasions and they offer great value for money on top of consistent taste.
Open_Time: Open 9.00 AM - 8.00 PM (11. 30 AM & 6.30 PM onwards for food collection)

Excerpt: Flavoured at Cinnamon Red, with their lean luxury theme, offers a curated menu with good variations at reasonable prices. They've got a good view of Colombo, tasty mains and excellent desserts, albeit with slightly slow service.

Restaurant_name: The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf (Liberty Plaza Podium)
Address: First Floor, Liberty Plaza Podium, Colombo 3
Excerpt: Coffee Bean is slowly turning into Colombo's next Barista - this is the third branch to pop up in the city at another very central location. The coffee and food here taste alright and are pricey as usual, and it's a comfy quiet place to chill out at.
Expensive, but probably the most modernist Sri Lankan cuisine you can get.

Address: 11, Global Towers Hotel, Marine Drive, Wellawatta, Colombo 06
Excerpt: Trainspotter at Global Towers is one of the few restaurants that's open 24 hours a day. Unfortunately, the entire experience is mediocre at best.
A simple home cook that serves shelled crab - a real pleasure to eat.
Open_Time: Open Call one day in advance

Excerpt: Fresheta is a small juice bar at the top of Chithra Lane. They serve up some refreshing, tasty juices which really hit the spot on a scorching day.
Really tasty burgers, but not cheap.
The Coffee Bar by the Grand Hotel is probably the best coffee shop in Nuwara Eliya. They've got a chic little space and an accessible location to go along with some good food and great coffee.
Praneetha is a small eatery that serves up a great rice and curry with the option of every kind of meat, from prawns to pork.
The Ceylon City Hotel is one of the newer new age hotels in Colombo. It's got good facilities at decent prices.

The Colombo Café  is a new competitor in Colombo’s café square off. While the prices of sandwiches and shakes can put your wallet on the endangered list, their Sri Lankan Buffet deal is the best deal we’ve come across.

Grand Thai is a relatively new Thai restaurant which resides at the former basement of The Grand Hotel. Taking the experience as a whole, we were very impressed. Good food, beautiful interior and some impeccable service.

Room Service is one of the more efficient delivery services around. Their delivery charges are higher than most others but they deliver from some high profile restaurants that you can't get otherwise.
Poonie's Kitchen is a wonderful hidden oasis in the Galle Fort. They serve high quality desserts and deliciously prepared dishes at surprisingly good prices.
Pilawoos, the biggest players on Colombo's kottu scene, have set up a bigger, more family friendly restaurant on Marine Drive. The kottu and iced milo are still stellar.
FLOW is a restaurant at the Hilton Residences that serves up  a variety of international and local cuisines.
The Anna Marie Bakery sounds like a place from a Beatrix Potter book. The food might as well be from the books too.

Address: 25, Taj Samudra Hotel, Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 3
Excerpt: Navratna, the Taj's Indian restaurant, is one of the few great places in the city for an authentic Indian dining experience.
Royal Bakery is an old timer from Colombo's original bakery scene, going way back to 1906. The shorteats and cakes are still pretty good, and they've expanded to serving rice and kottu too.
Curry Leaf is the Hilton's Sri Lankan restaurant, and their spread of local cuisine and fresh seafood is top notch. If you can afford the taxes, this is a must try.
Waves is so good I’d rather it be a secluded seafood jewel tucked at the bottom of Fairline road. The portion are generous and the fares are reasonable.
Macky's is a decent choice for big portions and sloppy, spicy Sri Lankan Chinese, pastas and meats.

Mount Grill is an old restaurant in Mount Lavinia that serves a lot of Sri Lankan favorites. The place looks pretty run down now, but the food is actually quite good, especially some of their meat dishes.

Address: 45 Janadhipathi Mw, Colombo 1 (entrance on Hospital Ln)
Excerpt: &Co is a new pub and restaurant tucked in the Steuart Hotel behind Dutch Hospital. They serve up good, hefty pub fare in a spacious setting.
Wonderbar is a sweet-toothed vegan's dream come true. They offer you gluten, sugar, and dairy-free desserts and smoothies,
Tatlers Tea is the usual YAMU tea break spot. It really isn't anything to write home about, but if you visit you just might bump into us!

Address: Siam View Hotel, Panama Road, Arugam Bay
Excerpt: Zephyr is a branch of the Mirissa spot. They do quite good food and drinks here.

Address: 15, Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
Excerpt: Sea Fish is a restaurant that's been around since the '70s, and its dining space still features music and lights from that era. Their seafood is however good, and they also do seafood BBQs in their backyard on request.
We all like the occasional slice of unorthodox pizza. But is Pizza Hut really worth the buck you're paying for it? Somewhat.
The Grand is a little coffee shop along the bustling  Colombo Road in Negombo. They serve really good drinks and some killer cheesecake for very decent prices.
CocoCeylon is a mysterious business that we spotted only on Instagram. They offer overpriced smoothies and chia puddings.
Open_Time: Open Monday to Friday 9 AM - 5 PM

Excerpt: Royal Burger is a very reliable stop on Havelock Road for cheese dripping, affordable burgers and subs. It's a popular lunch option among the RI students in the neighborhood.
Open_Time: Open Sunday - Thursday 10.00AM to 10.00PM, Friday - Saturday 10.00AM to 12.00AM

Excerpt: Seoul is a bright, sunlit, spanking new addition to the (mostly cheerless) Korean restaurants in the city.
Chop Chop does tasty, generous kottu all day, via drive through or delivery. Win.
The Cake Factory has opened a small cafe on 5th Lane that offers a slightly limited range of their cakes and desserts. The cakes were so-so, but their cheesecake was the real winner.
The King Coconut has a tropical vibe  with its roof dotted with coconut fronds and bamboo fences all round. It's also very chilled out, with a great view of the sea and the wind whipping around.
Dolce Vita is a rustic and snug little Italian restaurant / café which serves everything from breakfast menus to snazzy drinks, pizzas and gelato.
Oshella is a home cook who specializes in chocolatey desserts. Literally everything we tried was excellent, but her eclairs in particular were the best we've had in Colombo.
Open_Time: Open Pre-order (call anytime during the day)

Excerpt: MoMo's has an extensive menu ranging from naans to lasagna to seafood and pastas. It has a nice, comfy interior, and is a vibrant space for families.

Address: Cinnamon Lakeside, 115, Sir Chittampalam A.Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 02
Excerpt: The Dining Room specializes in international buffets at Cinnamon Lakeside.
You'll be pleasantly surprised by the quality of the breads, biscuits and baked goods at this Jaffna bakery and cafe.
Atrium is a Japanese/Fast Food restaurant in Thalawathugoda
Fab is one of the older and more established bakeries in town. The franchise is well known for its cakes.
Open_Time:
Open 6 AM - 8 PM Monday to Saturday
7 AM - 7 PM Sundays and Poya days

Excerpt: There's a McDonald's outside of Colombo as well.
Cookies and You claims to deliver Love at First Bite, and they live up to this promise. Their baked goods taste as great as their Instagram feed looks.
පානදුර පැත්තෙ ගියපු වෙලාවක රසම රස කෑම ටිකක් හිතේ හැටියට තෝරගෙන බඩ පැලෙනකන් කන්න කැම්රෝස් අවන්හල නම් කියාපු තැනක් තමයි.
Cool Berry is where the Juice Bar used to be. Despite their name and the extensive range of juices and smoothies on the menu, they don't have half of it.

Margie's Kitchen is a home cook in Mount Lavinia that specializes in Dutch Burgher and Portuegse influenced local dishes. While they offer a variety of dishes, most of it revolves around pork, and their briliant black pork curry is the coup de grâce.

Address: G-09, Crescat Boulevard, Galle Road, Colombo 03
Excerpt: Coco V at Crescat offers the same stuff as the Coco V at Ward Place, but the ambience isn't as chilled out as the other. Their signatures are coffees and cakes.
සුහදශීලි සේවක මඩුල්ලක් ඉන්න නිසා වෙලාව නාස්ති කරගන්නෙ නැතුව රස කෑම වේලක් කන්න නම් පුරහල සෙන්කඩ සලාකා අවන්හල හොඳ තැනක් කියලා කියන්න පුළුවන්.
The longstanding 88 Chinese Restaurant has opened up a branch in Dehiwela, serving most items except for all pork dishes.
යන එන ගමන් ගොඩවෙලා නිදහසේ කතා බහක යෙදෙන අතරෙ රසම රස ක්ෂණික ආහාර වේලක් රස බලන්න නම් මොරටුව ෆැබ් එක අපූරු තැනක්.
Sushi Kai is the new Japanese restaurant that's taken up the former location of Kami Maki. It may look familiar, but they fall well short when it comes to flavour and quality.
London House of Coffee is a new coffee shop located on Gregory's Road serving Ceylon Coffee - roasted in-house.
Rasa Sayang is a new Indian take-out restaurant on Hill St, run by the same management as The Malay Restaurant.
An attic converted into a cafe, The Stairway is a new spot in the Fort run by a resident. Good rice and curry.
The Governor's Restaurant at the Mount Lavinia Hotel is one of the few hotel restaurants that offers real value for money with their dishes.
ඇලුම්කා කේටර්ස් එකේ කෑමවල තියෙන විශේෂත්වය තමයි ගෙවන මුදලට ලැබෙන කෑම ප‍්‍රමාණයේ විශාලත්වය. ලොකු බඩගින්නක හිටියත් ඒක කාලා ඉවර කරන්න නම් ටිකක් අමාරුයි.

Kate Ryori is a homecook in Colombo that serves up tasty Japanese cuisine at affordable prices with some pretty filling portions to boot. It's a tiny operation, but she's pretty much the only Japanese homecook we know of and it's a great change-up from the usual Japanese restaurants.
A home-cook that's make seasonal Christmas pudding.
Open_Time: Open Call ahead, it's a home

Excerpt: A new place which specializes in biscuit puddings.
China Manor is a new hotel in Maradana with an authentic Chinese restaurant. Their crispy chicken is amazing.
A lawyer's chambers turned Moroccan/Italian restaurant, they do their own take on moussaka, hummus and baba ghanoush.
Having been around since 2002, Barista is one of the first coffee shops to have popped up in Colombo.
Open_Time:
Open 7AM -  12 Midnight (Friday and Saturday)
7AM - 11PM (Sunday to Thursday)

Restaurant_name: The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf (Galle Road)
Excerpt: Serves coffee, frappes, shakes, and a bunch of baked goodies.
They're supposed to be a tea room, but they serve rice & curry, lamprais and other random stuff.
''ත්‍රී ෆොර්ටි සර්'' මුදල් අයකැමි ගාණ කිව්වා. මගේ බඩ ගින්න එහෙම පිටින්ම නැතුව ගියා. ඒ මොකද කියල මගේ බත් පිඟානෙ ෆොටෝ එක දැක්කාම ඔයාලට තේරෙයි.

Flow Health Bar is a vegan health food stall in Ward Place that serves up a range of salads and healthy juices. Their stuff is undoubtedly healthy; however, their menu can be a bit confusing and their food just wasn't as flavoursome as we hoped.

Address: No. 42, D. S. Senanayake mawatha, Boerlla, Colombo 08
Excerpt: ඒ දවස් වල අපි ආරියබවන් එකෙන් බූන්දි 100කුත් අරන් කෙලින්ම යන්නෙ මැගසින් රෝඩ් පැත්තට. හී... ගිහින් එන කොට අපිත් බූන්දි වගේ. පාට පාට වෙලා!
One of the Fort's quintessential spots for accommodation and breakfast.
මිල ගණන් එක්ක බැලුවාම නම් වාඩි Food එකේ කෑම  වල රස ටිකක් විතර හොඳයි . ඒ වුනාට වැඩිපුර වියදම් කරල සුපිරි කෑම වේලක් කන්න තැනක් හොයන කෙනෙක්ට නම් මේ කඩේ හරියන එකක් නෑ මට හිතෙන්නෙ.

Address: 931C,  Ethul Kotte Road (Off Parliament Road), Ethul Kotte
Excerpt: With a great setting, decor and beautiful presentation, Chapter one disappoints when it comes down to execution.
One of Negombo's long term dining institutions.

Address: Thulasi Hotel, Udaya Raja mawatha, Badulla.
Excerpt: ආයෙ දවසක බදුල්ල පැත්තෙ රවුමක් දාන්න ඇවිත් පාන්දරින්ම බැස්සත් හිතට බයක් නෑනෙ. අංකල්ගෙ තුලසි හෝටලේ උදේ 6ට අරිනවනෙ.
Whipping up some mouthwatering Sri Lankan and Western/ Fusion cuisine, Kaduruketha's restaurant is elegant and mouthwatering.

Address: 7 Barnes Place Residencies, Barnes Place, Colombo 07
Excerpt: A homebaker based in heart of Colombo 7 who specializes in peanut butter jelly cookies.
Mune's Kalu Dodol is one of two places that we know of, that delivers high quality dodol to your doorstep.

Address: Mongolian sea food, B 1, Majestic city, Colombo 04.
Excerpt: එකම අවුල තියෙන්නෙ කන්න ආපු අයගෙ සතුටු සාමීචි වල අතුරු ප්‍රථිඵල. කන්කරච්චලේ කියල කියන්නෙ.

The Scarlet room is Colombo Courtyard's Italian restaurant. Their all red theme may not appeal to some, but we found the food to be surprisingly affordable. Execution was a mixed bag, with a few dishes missing the mark and others doing quite well.
A mix of authentic and Sri Lankanized Chinese food, run by the friendliest Chinese lady.
Sentosa is a Singaporean restaurant which seems to focus more on Malaysian fare, but also serves In
Home of the best beef samosa. Gadaby is perfect for your short eat fix on the East Coast.
A hotel and restaurant, Cosy's dishes up Sri Lankan, Indian, and Chinese cuisine. We'd recommend sticking to the Jaffna specials. Obviously.
Words cannot describe this experience. Only tears.
Open_Time: Open Totally arbitrary.  Call and ask.

Excerpt: Simple and healthy, Kumbuk does everything right with local, seasonal and organic ingredients.

101/11 Hunupitiya Lake Road,
Colombo 2,

Excerpt: New rooftop Italian fine dining restaurant behind Gangaramaya Temple
A home baker who specializes in something other than cupcakes and cookies.
කඩේ නම Hot Cabin. ලොකු ලොකු කෑම ජාති නම් නෑ. ඒ වුනාට හොඳ සුවඳක් නම් එනවා. සෙනඟත් ටිකක් ඉන්න නිසා අපි හිතුවා රෑ කෑම වේල ගන්න මෙතන ගැලපෙයි කියලා.
Bliss lounge is a Mediterranean sheesha lounge which serves Italian and burgers, among other things.
Isso deals with isso. Curried isso, tossed isso, isso with roast paan, and isso with bathala chips. Yes.

A bar and restaurant that's great for its ambiance if you live in Nawala.
Sameeha's is popular for their cheese kottu, and is one of THE places to drop into in Negombo.

Address:
Off Chandra Wettasinghe Mawatha,
Koswatte Road, 
Nawala
Excerpt: Big Mama's does Dutch food like lamprais, bolofiado, fougeti and olliebollen with a Sri Lankan twist.
හීනියට ලියල බැදපු කුකුල් මස් කෑලි, සොසේජස් කෑලි, තම්බපු ඉස්සො, බැදපු තෝර මාළු කෑලි හරි හරියට හැන්දට එද්දි දැනෙන සතුට රසටත් උඩින්.
Bubbly stuff and paninis and desserts.
A charming little bubble tea spot in the Fort.
A tiny restaurant that serves up lunch and dinner, with a Sri Lankan and Indian menu.
An excellent seafood restaurant in a rather out-of-the-way location, paired with great service.
Pretty macaroons and beautiful cupcake toppings, with a cartload of sugar.
A monolith of a building on the Colombo-Kandy road with decent food and plenty of great tea.
Dottie's is a charming English tea room serving up tea, fry-ups, and desserts on intricately delicate china and lace with a side of great service.
Grand Indian is Nuwara Eliya's go to Indian restaurant . They serve up top notch North Indian cuisine at reasonable prices with impressive consistency.
The main restaurant at the luxe Jetwing Lighthouse Club in Galle, serving up special degustation menus and bespoke dishes.
A home baker who specializes in amazing brownies. She also makes savory goodies.
Eastern Wok is a multi-cuisine restaurant that serves Chinese, Indian and Arabian food.
A city hotel in the depths of Wattala. Rather nice place, but mediocre food and service.
The go-to place for submarines since 1996.
A nice little place that serves  good fruit juices for a really low cost.
A mainstream Indian restaurant that caters  to an assortment of dishes, ranging  from Chinese, to the odd Macaroni, quail, speciality egg dishes and submarines.

Address:
No: 245, Havelock Road, Colombo 06
(Opposite Havelock City)
Excerpt: A  petite little shop that houses mouthwatering little sweet treats down Havelock Road. They specialise in a wide variety of Indian sweetmeats and savouries.
